block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Branford Judy Cook and Diane Taraz, folk. April 14 at 8 p.m. $12. First Congregational Church of Branford, 1009 Main Street. (203) 488-7201. Bridgeport Joe Carter Samba Rio Trio. April 14 at 8 p.m. $12.50; students, $8. Black Rock Art Center, 2838 Fairfield Avenue. (203) 367-7917. Fairfield ''Cinderella,'' presented by the Moscow Festival Ballet. Friday at 8 p.m. $30 to $40. Quick Center for the Arts, 1073 North Benson Road. (203) 254-4010.
Middletown ''Mixin' It Up: Adventures in Yiddish Swing,'' performed by Hankus Netsky. April 15 at 4 p.m. Free. Crowell Concert Hall, Center for the Arts, Wesleyan University. (860) 685-3355.
Milford ''Intimate Jazz, Art of Trio;'' Rex Cadwallader, piano, David Chevan, bass, and Matt Darriau, clarinet. Friday at 8 p.m. $12. Milford Center for the Arts, 40 Railroad Avenue. (203) 878-6647.
New Haven Tokyo String Quartet; works by Haydn, Schumann and Beethoven. Tuesday at 8 p.m. $13 to $26. Sprague Hall, Yale University, College and Wall Streets. (203) 432-4158.

Storrs Janacek's ''Kreutzer Sonata'' and other works, presented by the Vermeer String Quartet. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. $28. El Gran Combo, Latin dance music. April 14 at 7 p.m. $25 and $30. Jorgensen Center for the Performing Arts, 2132 Hillside Road, University of Connecticut. (860) 486-4226.
THEATER

Danbury Gilbert and Sullivan's ''Pirates of Penzance'' and ''Trial by Jury.'' Friday at 7: 30 p.m. and April 14 at 2 and 7:30 p.m. $15; seniors and students, $10. Ives Concert Hall in White Hall, 181 White Street, Western Connecticut University Midtown Campus. (203) 837-8350.

Hartford ''The Spitfire Grill,'' musical by Fred Alley and James Valcq, presented by the Hartford Conservatory Diploma School. Friday at 2 and 8 p.m.; April 14 at 3 and 8 p.m.; April 15 at 3 p.m. $17.50; seniors and students, $15. Asylum Hill Congregation Church, 814 Asylum Hill. (860) 246-2588.
Hartford ''Murderers'' by Jeffrey Hatcher. Friday through May 27. $10 to $45. TheaterWorks Hartford, 233 Pearl Street. (860) 527-7838.
Ivoryton ''Someone Who'll Watch Over Me'' by Frank McGuiness. Through April 22. $15 to $32. Ivoryton Playhouse, 103 Main Street. (860) 767-7318.
New Haven ''The Blue Album'' by David Cale and Dael Orlandersmith, directed by Gordon Edelstein. Through April 29. $41.25 to $61.25. Long Wharf Theater, 222 Sargent Drive. (203) 787-4282.
New Haven ''Doubt'' by John Patrick Shanley, directed by Doug Hughes. Through April 8. $29 to $56. Shubert Theater, 247 College Street. (203) 624-1825.
New Haven ''The Seven Deadly Sins'' by Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht, directed by Joseph Crematori. April 12 through April 14. $10 to $15. Yale Cabaret, 217 Park Street. (203) 432-1566.
New Haven ''Lulu'' by Frank Wedekind, directed by Mark Lamos. Through April 21. $22.50 to $55. Yale Repertory Theater, 1120 Chapel Street. (203) 432-1234.
Torrington The Nancy Marine Studio Theater Season: ''Godspell.'' Friday through April 22. $10.50 to $17.50. Warner Theater, 68 Main Street. (860) 489-7180.
Waterbury ''Viagara Falls,'' comedy by Joao Machado and Lou Cutell, directed by Don Crichton. Through April 15. $27 to $45. Seven Angels Theater, Plank Road in Hamilton Park Pavilion. (203) 757-4676.
West Hartford Edward Albee's ''Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?'' Through April 15. $25. Park Road Playhouse, 244 Park Road. (860) 586-8500.
Westport ''All About Us,'' by Joseph Stein, directed by Gabriel Barre. Tuesday through April 28. $40 to $60. Westport Country Playhouse, 25 Powers Court. (203) 227-4177.
Westport ''Born Yesterday'' by Garson Kanin, presented by the Westport Community Theater. Through April 15. $12 to $16. Westport Town Hall, 110 Myrtle Avenue. (203) 226-1983.
FILM
Bridgeport ''Jesus Camp,'' documentary directed by Heidi Ewing and Rachel Grady. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Free. Acoustic Cafe, 2926 Fairfield Avenue. (203) 335-3655.

Bridgeport Flicks and Food: ''City of God,'' directed by Fernando Meirelles and Kátia Lund; in Portuguese with English subtitles. Friday at 7 p.m. $6; $20 with dinner; reservations required. Black Rock Art Center, 2838 Fairfield Avenue. (203) 367-7917.

Greenwich ''The Girl in the Cafe'' directed by David Yates. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. Greenwich Library, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 622-7900. Hartford ''Volver,'' directed by Pedro Almodóvar; in Spanish with English subtitles. Thursday and April 7 at 7:30 p.m.; April 8 at 2 p.m. $3 to $8. Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, 600 Main Street. (860) 838-4058.
New Haven ''O Lucky Man!'' directed by Lindsay Anderson. April 14 at 1:30 p.m. Free. Yale Center for British Art, 1080 Chapel Street. (203) 432-2800.
OUTDOORS

Stratford ''A Walking Tour of Hamlet's Dresser,'' guided tour exploring the Stratford sights mentioned in Rob Smith's memoir. April 14 at 11 a.m. Free. Stratford Library, 2203 Main Street. (203) 385-4162.
SPOKEN WORD
Greenwich ''Shaping the City and Spirit of Rome,'' lecture on Roman landscape architecture by Laurie D. Olin. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Bruce Museum of Arts and Sciences, 1 Museum Drive. (203) 869-0376.
Greenwich Walter Isaacson, author of ''Einstein: His Life and Universe.'' April 15 at 2 p.m. Free. Greenwich Library, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 622-7900.
Guilford Sue Ellen Thompson, poet. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Women and Family Life Center, 96 Fair Street. (203) 453-8836.

Middletown ''Civil Rights: In the Day, Today and Tomorrow,'' lecture presented by Julian Bond, chairman of the board of the N.A.A.C.P. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Center for the Arts, Wesleyan University. (860) 685-3355.
West Haven Roya Hakakian, author of ''Journey From the Land of No: A Childhood Caught in Revolutionary Iran.'' Thursday at 11:30 a.m. Free. Dodds Auditorium, University of New Haven. (203) 932-7246.
FOR CHILDREN
Bridgeport ''Beauty and the Beast,'' comical version of the children's play. Through May 20. $13.50. Downtown Cabaret Theater, 263 Golden Hill Street. (203) 576-1636.

Bridgeport ''Creativity Ignited!'' Interactive children's exhibition exploring the imagination. Through April 30. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. The Discovery Museum, 4450 Park Avenue. (203) 372-3521.

Greenwich Young People's Concert: Jana, Native-American singer-songwriter. Ages 6 and up. April 15 at 3 p.m. $3; reservations recommended. Bruce Museum of Arts and Sciences, 1 Museum Drive. (203) 869-0376.

New Haven ''Hansel and Gretel,'' puppet theater presented by Théâtre Sans Fil; followed by puppet-making workshop. Ages 6 and up. Friday and April 14 at 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. $19.25; children, $13.25. Long Wharf Theater, 222 Sargent Drive. (203) 787-4282.
Norwalk ''Free Soccer Clinic,'' presented by the Norwalk Community Soccer Club. April 15, 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Free. Stepping Stones Museum for Children, 303 West Avenue. (203) 899-0606.

Southport Free Young Person's Concert Series: Rossini's ''Barber of Seville,'' presented by the Boston Lyric Opera Company. April 14, 1:30 and 3:30 p.m. Free. Pequot Library, 720 Pequot Avenue. (203) 938-3843.
Stamford ''Mexican Storycraft.'' Listen to stories from Mexico and make maracas. Ages 3 to 8. April 14 at 11 a.m. Free. Ferguson Library Main Branch, 1 Public Library Plaza. (203) 964-1000.
Torrington Selected readings by Mary Pope Osborne and Will Osborne, authors of the ''Magic Tree House'' series. April 15 at 2 p.m. $7 to $20. Warner Theater, 68 Main Street. (860) 489-7180.

West Hartford ''Color Play: The Art and Science of Color and Light,'' explore light and holographic refraction. Ages 12 and under. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. The Children's Museum, 950 Trout Brook Drive. (860) 231-2824.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Brookfield ''Fiber Cartography: Mapping Imagination and Experience,'' works by 10 fiber artists. Through April 29. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Brookfield Craft Center, 286 Whisconier Road. (203) 775-4526.

Greenwich ''Zip, Bop and Whir: Toys of the 20th Century,'' exhibition exploring the evolution of toy technology. Through July 8. ''Painterly Controversy: William Merritt Chase and Robert Henri.'' Through April 29. ''Weaving a Collection: Native American Baskets From the Bruce Museum.'' Through June 10. $7; seniors and students, $6; children 5 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bruce Museum of Arts and Sciences, 1 Museum Drive. (203) 869-0376.

Greenwich ''Natural Elements,'' works by Bryan Nash Gill, Catherine Kernan and Eve Stockton. Through April 26. Hours: Mondays through Wednesdays and Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Flinn Gallery, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 622-7947.
Hamden Display of five panels of the AIDS Memorial Quilt. Monday and Tuesday, 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. Free. Alumni Hall, Quinnipiac University. (203) 582-8425.

Hartford ''Soul Food: African-American Cooking and Creativity,'' art and artifacts exploring Southern cooking and culture; presented by the Amistad Center for Art and Culture. Through April 22. ''Faith and Fortune: Five Centuries of European Masterworks,'' exhibition of European masterworks and sculpture from the museum's collection. Through Dec. 9. ''Picasso to Pop: Aspects of Modern Art,'' exhibition of the museum's holdings from many 20th-century genres. Through Nov. 18. $3 to $10; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; first Thursdays of the month, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, 600 Main Street. (860) 838-4058.
Litchfield Works by Nancy Lasar and Amanda Branson. Through April 15. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. New Arts Gallery, 513 Maple Street. (860) 567-5015.

Mashantucket ''Booming Out: Mohawk Ironworkers Build New York,'' photographs and sculpture documenting the Mohawk sky-walking construction tradition passed through six generations. Through May 27. $10 to $15; children under 6, free. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; last admission, 3 p.m. Mashantucket Pequot Museum and Research Center, 110 Pequot Trail. (800) 411-9671.

Middletown ''Etching Since 1950.'' Through April 8. ''A Newspaperman's Eye,'' American photographs from the collection of Russell G. D'Oench. Through May 27. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Davison Art Center, 301 High Street, Wesleyan University. (860) 685-2500.

Middletown ''Brushwork by Kazuaki Tanahashi.'' Through May 6. free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Mansfield Freeman Center for East Asian Studies Gallery, Wesleyan University, 343 Washington Terrace. (860) 685-2330.

New Haven ''Random Access Memory,'' works dealing with memory by Liz Pagano and Colleen Tully. Through April 29. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Arts + Literature Laboratory, 319 Peck Street. (203) 671-5175.

New Haven ''Women's Studies: New Works by Mary Lesser.'' Through April 29. Reception: April 15, 3 to 6 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. City Gallery, 994 State Street. (203) 782-2489.

New Haven ''Ceramic Abstraction: Exploration and Evidence,'' juried group exhibition. Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Creative Arts Workshop, 80 Audubon Street. (203) 562-4927.

New Haven ''New Haven's Garment Workers: An Elm City Story,'' photographs and artifacts documenting the 20th-century garment industry. Through May 4. Free. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to noon. Ethnic Heritage Center, 270 Fitch Street. (203) 392-6126.

New Haven ''Surface Explorations,'' works by Karen Green Recor. Through April 28. Reception: Friday, 5 to 7 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. White Space Gallery, 1020 Chapel Street. (203) 495-1200.

New Haven ''UNStudio: Evolution of Space,'' exhibition of five projects by the Amsterdam-based firm. Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Yale School of Architecture Gallery, 180 York Street. (203) 432-2889.

New London ''Beyond Voodoo: Art From Haiti,'' works by various artists. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m. ALVA Gallery, 54 State Street. (860) 437-8664.

New Milford ''Rural Wealth,'' photographs by Ray Kwiatkowski. Through May 5. Hours: Mondays, Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. New Milford Public Library, 24 Main Street. (860) 355-1191.

Old Lyme ''Shadows and Pulls: A Short History,'' photographs by Ellen Carey. Through May 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Diane Birdsall Gallery, 68 Lyme Street. (860) 434-3209.

Old Lyme ''The Freedom Business: Connecticut Landscapes Through the Eyes of Venture Smith,'' poems by Marilyn Nelson paired with paintings from the museum's collection. Through June 24. ''A Circle of Friends: The Artists of the Florence Griswold Museum.'' Through July 1. $4 to $8; under 6, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Florence Griswold Museum, 96 Lyme Street. (860) 434-5542.

Ridgefield ''The Photograph as Canvas,'' works by artists who draw or paint on photographs. Through June 10. ''Tekrar,'' sound installation by David Abir. Through Aug. 12. ''W(E)AVE,'' sound and textile collaboration from Elana Herzog and Michael Schumacher. Through Aug. 12. ''Blow Ups: Spores, Pollen and Pollutants,'' works by Kysa Johnson. Through June 10. ''Castles, Dwarfs and Happychaps,'' work by Arturo Herrera created using the Renaissance technique of pouncing. Through Sept. 2. ''Chrysanthemum Anthems,'' sculpture by Dario Robleto based on American soldiers' experience of wars. Through June 17. $7; seniors and students, $4; members, kindergarten through 12 teachers and children under 18, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Aldrich Contemporary Art Museum, 258 Main Street. all(203) 438-4519.

Stamford ''Great Dames Part Trois,'' works by female artists. Through April10. Hours: Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Loft Artist Gallery at Yale and Towne, 737 Canal Street. (203) 323-4153.

Storrs ''Salvage Research Soul Training,'' installation by Nari Ward. Through Friday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Contemporary Art Galleries, 830 Bolton Road, University of Connecticut, Storrs Campus. (860) 486-1511.

Storrs ''Intemperate Times: Kathe Kollwitz, 1918-1934.'' Through May 6. ''Tradition and Innovation: Latin American Art From the Benton Collection.'' Through June 17. ''Old Master Drawings and Prints,'' exhibition of 15 Italian and Dutch works dating from 1539 to 1690. Through May 6. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4:30 p.m. William Benton Museum of Art, 245 Glenbrook Road. (860) 486-4520.

Stratford ''Art in Nature,'' photographs by Ellen Fairbend. Through April 30. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Stratford Library, 2203 Main Street. (203) 385-4162.
West Hartford Works by Paul Bowen and Pat de Groot. Through May 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Brick Walk Fine Art, 322 Park Road. (860) 233-1730.
Westport Oil paintings by Yetvart Kaprielian. Through April 27. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Galerie Je Reviens, 991 Post Road East. (203) 227-7716.

Westport ''States of Connecticut,'' juried exhibition with works by various artists. Through April 29. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Westport Arts Center, 51 Riverside Avenue. (203) 222-7070.
Willimantic ''Indigo: Traditional Chinese Blue Textiles.'' Through April 22. $5; students and seniors, $3.50. Windham Textile and History Museum, 411 Main Street. (860) 456-2178.

Wilton ''Beyond the Lines,'' monoprints and paintings by Susan Newbold. Through April 18. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockwell Art Gallery in Wilton, 379 Danbury Road. (203) 762-8311.
Woodbury ''Pattern Play,'' paintings by Anne Hebebrand and sculpture by Diana Chamberlain. Through May 13. Fenn Gallery, 345 Main Street South. (203) 263-3449.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.

Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; first Thursdays of the month, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, 600 Main Street. (860) 838-4058.
Litchfield Works by Nancy Lasar and Amanda Branson. Through April 15. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. New Arts Gallery, 513 Maple Street. (860) 567-5015.

Mashantucket ''Booming Out: Mohawk Ironworkers Build New York,'' photographs and sculpture documenting the Mohawk sky-walking construction tradition passed through six generations. Through May 27. $10 to $15; children under 6, free. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; last admission, 3 p.m. Mashantucket Pequot Museum and Research Center, 110 Pequot Trail. (800) 411-9671.

Middletown ''Etching Since 1950.'' Through April 8. ''A Newspaperman's Eye,'' American photographs from the collection of Russell G. D'Oench. Through May 27. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Davison Art Center, 301 High Street, Wesleyan University. (860) 685-2500.

Middletown ''Brushwork by Kazuaki Tanahashi.'' Through May 6. free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Mansfield Freeman Center for East Asian Studies Gallery, Wesleyan University, 343 Washington Terrace. (860) 685-2330.

New Haven ''Random Access Memory,'' works dealing with memory by Liz Pagano and Colleen Tully. Through April 29. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Arts + Literature Laboratory, 319 Peck Street. (203) 671-5175.

New Haven ''Women's Studies: New Works by Mary Lesser.'' Through April 29. Reception: April 15, 3 to 6 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. City Gallery, 994 State Street. (203) 782-2489.

New Haven ''Ceramic Abstraction: Exploration and Evidence,'' juried group exhibition. Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Creative Arts Workshop, 80 Audubon Street. (203) 562-4927.

New Haven ''New Haven's Garment Workers: An Elm City Story,'' photographs and artifacts documenting the 20th-century garment industry. Through May 4. Free. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to noon. Ethnic Heritage Center, 270 Fitch Street. (203) 392-6126.

New Haven ''Surface Explorations,'' works by Karen Green Recor. Through April 28. Reception: Friday, 5 to 7 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. White Space Gallery, 1020 Chapel Street. (203) 495-1200.

New Haven ''UNStudio: Evolution of Space,'' exhibition of five projects by the Amsterdam-based firm. Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Yale School of Architecture Gallery, 180 York Street. (203) 432-2889.

New London ''Beyond Voodoo: Art From Haiti,'' works by various artists. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m. ALVA Gallery, 54 State Street. (860) 437-8664.

New Milford ''Rural Wealth,'' photographs by Ray Kwiatkowski. Through May 5. Hours: Mondays, Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. New Milford Public Library, 24 Main Street. (860) 355-1191.

Old Lyme ''Shadows and Pulls: A Short History,'' photographs by Ellen Carey. Through May 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Diane Birdsall Gallery, 68 Lyme Street. (860) 434-3209.

Old Lyme ''The Freedom Business: Connecticut Landscapes Through the Eyes of Venture Smith,'' poems by Marilyn Nelson paired with paintings from the museum's collection. Through June 24. ''A Circle of Friends: The Artists of the Florence Griswold Museum.'' Through July 1. $4 to $8; under 6, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Florence Griswold Museum, 96 Lyme Street. (860) 434-5542.

Ridgefield ''The Photograph as Canvas,'' works by artists who draw or paint on photographs. Through June 10. ''Tekrar,'' sound installation by David Abir. Through Aug. 12. ''W(E)AVE,'' sound and textile collaboration from Elana Herzog and Michael Schumacher. Through Aug. 12. ''Blow Ups: Spores, Pollen and Pollutants,'' works by Kysa Johnson. Through June 10. ''Castles, Dwarfs and Happychaps,'' work by Arturo Herrera created using the Renaissance technique of pouncing. Through Sept. 2. ''Chrysanthemum Anthems,'' sculpture by Dario Robleto based on American soldiers' experience of wars. Through June 17. $7; seniors and students, $4; members, kindergarten through 12 teachers and children under 18, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Aldrich Contemporary Art Museum, 258 Main Street. all(203) 438-4519.

Stamford ''Great Dames Part Trois,'' works by female artists. Through April10. Hours: Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Loft Artist Gallery at Yale and Towne, 737 Canal Street. (203) 323-4153.

Storrs ''Salvage Research Soul Training,'' installation by Nari Ward. Through Friday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Contemporary Art Galleries, 830 Bolton Road, University of Connecticut, Storrs Campus. (860) 486-1511.

Storrs ''Intemperate Times: Kathe Kollwitz, 1918-1934.'' Through May 6. ''Tradition and Innovation: Latin American Art From the Benton Collection.'' Through June 17. ''Old Master Drawings and Prints,'' exhibition of 15 Italian and Dutch works dating from 1539 to 1690. Through May 6. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4:30 p.m. William Benton Museum of Art, 245 Glenbrook Road. (860) 486-4520.

Stratford ''Art in Nature,'' photographs by Ellen Fairbend. Through April 30. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Stratford Library, 2203 Main Street. (203) 385-4162.
West Hartford Works by Paul Bowen and Pat de Groot. Through May 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Brick Walk Fine Art, 322 Park Road. (860) 233-1730.
Westport Oil paintings by Yetvart Kaprielian. Through April 27. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Galerie Je Reviens, 991 Post Road East. (203) 227-7716.

Westport ''States of Connecticut,'' juried exhibition with works by various artists. Through April 29. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Westport Arts Center, 51 Riverside Avenue. (203) 222-7070.
Willimantic ''Indigo: Traditional Chinese Blue Textiles.'' Through April 22. $5; students and seniors, $3.50. Windham Textile and History Museum, 411 Main Street. (860) 456-2178.

Wilton ''Beyond the Lines,'' monoprints and paintings by Susan Newbold. Through April 18. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockwell Art Gallery in Wilton, 379 Danbury Road. (203) 762-8311.
Woodbury ''Pattern Play,'' paintings by Anne Hebebrand and sculpture by Diana Chamberlain. Through May 13. Fenn Gallery, 345 Main Street South. (203) 263-3449.
